page.title: 12POWER LINES IN N.W.PENRITH
page.content: Our geographical position to the North of Shap Fell,with its sometimes inhospitable weather & difficult terrain, has meant that Road & Rail communications have had to run through a narrow corridor right across the North-West Penrith area. Similar constraints,and the necessity for continuity of supply in all weathers,affected the way in which the Electricity Supply network was planned, and although we have no Power Stations anywhere near us, our area has both 275kV & 132kV Overhead Power Lines running through it(as well as the more usual 33kV) which are major arteries of the National Grid.
